author: John Otis
title: Colombia’s Top Presidential Hopefuls: Ex-Rebel or Critic of Peace Pact With Rebels
text:
BOGOTÁ, Colombia—The top two candidates in Sunday’s presidential election offer Colombians a stark choice: a law-and-order conservative versus a former guerrilla and admirer of the late Venezuelan strongman, Hugo Chávez.
The emergence of Iván Duque, the rightist front-runner, and fiery leftist Gustavo Petro show how the end of a long guerrilla conflict and the crisis in neighboring Venezuela have scrambled Colombia’s politics—making it at once more divisive and more inclusive. Mr. Petro is the first ex-rebel with a realistic...
